error.already_configured: Integration is already configured for this user.
error.invalid_token_format: Invalid token provided. The token must start with 'oauth2_4/' (OAuth) or 'aas_et/' (master, 223 characters).

user.title: Enter credentials
user.description: Enter your username and token for your Google account. You can use either a master token or an OAuth token. See [Readme]({invalid_auth_url}) for instructions on how to obtain a token.

options.title: Configure options
options.description: Choose lists to synchronize and configure other options.

data_description.lists_to_sync: Choose which lists to synchronize. You can select multiple lists. Archived or deleted lists are not shown here.
data_description.list_prefix: (Optional, can be blank) Add a unique identifier to the front of each list name in Home Assistant. For example, entering 'Google' will display your shopping list as 'Google Shopping List'. Leave empty to have the lists named as they are in Google Keep.
data_description.list_auto_sort: If checked, all of your selected lists will be changed to be sorted alphabetically. This is bidirectional, so your lists in both Home Assistant and Google Keep will be sorted.
data_description.list_item_case: Changes all of your list items to the given case. Default is to not change anything. This is bidirectional, so your list items in both Home Assistant and Google Keep will be changed.

reauth_confirm.title: Reauthenticate
reauth_confirm.description: The Google Keep Sync integration needs to re-authenticate your account. You can enter either a master token or an OAuth token.
